Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "Annie Hall" and "The Hurt Locker".
"Annie Hall" is a classic film directed by Woody Allen. The movie follows the romantic relationship between Alvy Singer (played by Allen) and Annie Hall (played by Keaton). The movie explores themes of love, marriage, and personal growth.
"The Hurt Locker" is another critically acclaimed film directed by Peter Berg. The movie follows the experiences of three US military Explosive Ordnance Disposal teams in Iraq during 2006-2007. The movie explores themes of war, trauma, resilience, and personal growth.
Overall, "Annie Hall" and "The Hurt Locker" are both highly regarded films with great performances by the actors. I hope you enjoy these recommendations!
